pullRequest.body:
This linter tries to make sure that the source code looks like the pretty printed version of itself.

It is not intended to be always active, since not every pretty-printed syntax is desirable or type-correct!

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [53981589ed](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15535/commits/53981589ed4b2be7e58f95c36d27fc2543dc6299)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +5.00% | `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter` |

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4266 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 180342 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ capSourceInfo`
`+ capSyntax`
`+ polishPP`
`+ polishSource`
`+ posToShiftedPos`
`+ ppRoundtrip`
`+ zoomString`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@adomani: I've pushed my suggestions myself now, adopting some responsibility for this PR, as I think it's a nice tool!

Therefore, somebody else will have to review it. (~~I might post in the correct Zulip channel about it~~ [Zulip message](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2315535.20Pedantic.20Linter))
Thanks, Jon!  As you can see, I have stretched myself a little too thin on PRs and I am very happy to receive help!  :smile:
lgtm

maintainer merge

(please have a bit a deeper look again: the last commits by myself are essentially unreviewed -- mostly simple fixes)
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

Pedantic comment: what do you think of renaming this to something like `ppRoundTrip` instead of `pedantic`? I think that's a bit more descriptive. "pedantic" can be anything, not necessarily formatting-related.
Otherwise, LGTM

Johan, thank you for the comment: I like the new name!

As for the large import, I think that this is to be expected by a linter: it is imported in `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter` and in turn this file is imported virtually everywhere.
Is there anything preventing this linter from landing? All outstanding comments seem to be addressed, CI passes, the linter is disabled by default anyway...
I think that all that is missing is a maintainer merging it.  😊

Will this help then? :-)
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11232911125/job/31225487842)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11232911125/job/31225487504)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I think this looks good, but as you said it should be disabled unless manually enabled.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

~~Didn't you say this should be `false` by default? I assume this is for testing and will be changed before merging.~~

This should be set to `false`
If the linter is turned off by default, this isn't necessary

```suggestion
```
Same as in another PR: imo it's barely worth when you can just write `Linter.getLinterValue linter.pedantic (← getOptions)` below...
Update: I think to remember that `getLinterHash` was a problem in other PRs and you should directly call `Linter.getLinterValue linter.pedantic (← getOptions)`, do I remember that correctly?
You can probably drop the debug comments now.

```suggestion
    let stx := capSyntax stx (stx.getTailPos?.getD default).1
```
can the pedantic linter pedantic-lint itself? ;)
what's this last comment about?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Tactic/Linter): the ppRoundtrip linter
